str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Harmony of instruments, music. From sumphonos; unison of sound, i.e. A concert of instruments.
A dance, dancing. Of uncertain derivation; a ring, i.e. Round dance
